    Orazio, Alessandro

    • Method Detail

      • addLogEntry

        public static boolean addLogEntry(int sequenceNumber,
                                  String collectionName,
                                  String directory,
                                  int cycle,
                                  double meanAdd,
                                  double meanDownload,
                                  double stdDevAdd,
                                  double stdDevDownload,
                                  int state,
                                  String timestamp)
        Writes a LogEntry in the log file
        Parameters:
        sequenceNumber - sequence number of the db write operation
        collectionName - name of the db collection
        directory - directory of the test result
        cycle - cycle of the test result
        meanAdd - Mean Execution time for the add operations in the submitted test
        meanDownload - Mean Execution time for the downloadoperations in the submitted test
        stdDevAdd - Standard Deviation of Execution time for the add operations in the submitted test
        stdDevDownload - Standard Deviation of Execution time for the download operations in the submitted test
        state - state of the test result
        timestamp - timestamp of the test result
        Returns:
        boolean, true if write succeed

      • checkLogFile

        public static boolean checkLogFile()
        Check if the log file exists, if not creates it.
        Returns:
        boolean, false if the log file creation failed.

      • getMaxSequenceNumber

        public static int getMaxSequenceNumber()
        get the max sequence number in use in the log file, -1 if none
        Returns:

      • readEntries

        public static ArrayList<LogEntry> readEntries()
        Reads all entries from log file
        Returns:
        ArrayList of LogEntry containing the entries of the log file

      • writeEntries

        public static boolean writeEntries(ArrayList<LogEntry> entries)
        Writes an ArrayList of LogEntry in the log file
        Parameters:
        entries - the Arraylist of LogEntry
        Returns:
        boolean, true if write succeed
